question: The figure shows variation of R, <katex>$X_{L}$</katex> and <katex>$X_{C}$</katex> with frequency 'f' in a series LCR circuit. Then for what frequency point is the circuit capacitive?
images/e4d3c2b1-a1b2-4c3d-8e9f-000000000005.png
explanation: A series LCR circuit is capacitive when <katex>$X_C > X_L$</katex>.
<katex>$X_C \propto 1/f$</katex> decreases with frequency, while <katex>$X_L \propto f$</katex> increases with frequency.
Therefore, the circuit is capacitive at lower frequencies (before resonance).
Point A is at a frequency lower than the intersection (resonance point B), so the circuit is capacitive at A.
